meanings.definition: A gift or token given for good luck or as an expression of good wishes.
meanings.sent1: On her birthday, Sarah received a handsel from her grandmother for good luck.
meanings.sent2: The handsel he received from his friend brought him good fortune.
meanings.sent3: The handsel from the leprechaun made the day even more magical.
meanings.sent4: The handsel of a lucky charm was like a little piece of happiness in his pocket.
meanings.sent5: The handsel of a four-leaf clover was a precious symbol of good fortune.

meanings.definition: To give a gift or token for good luck or as an expression of good wishes.
meanings.sent1: She decided to handsel her best friend with a lucky charm for her new job.
meanings.sent2: He handselled his sister with a small trinket before her big exam.
meanings.sent3: The magician handselled the audience with a surprise trick at the end of the show.
meanings.sent4: The teacher handselled the students with encouraging words before the test.
meanings.sent5: The coach handselled the team with a motivational speech before the championship game.
